exceptions.exn: In environment x, y : Z Hx : x > 0 Hy : y > 0 Unable to unify "(?M1410 ?= ?M1411) = Gt -> False" with "(x * y ?= 0) = Gt".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall x y : Z, x > 0 -> y > 0 -> Z.mul x y > 0

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Zgt_sign_neg_neg : forall x y : Z, 0 > x -> 0 > y -> x * y > 0
OMEGA4 : forall x y z : Z, x > 0 -> y > x -> z * y + x <> 0
OMEGA3 : forall x y k : Z, k > 0 -> x = y * k -> x = 0 -> y = 0
OMEGA2 : forall x y : Z, 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x + y
Zlt_sign_neg_neg : forall x y : Z, x < 0 -> y < 0 -> 0 < x * y
OMEGA7 : forall x y z t : Z, z > 0 -> t > 0 -> 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x * z + y * t
Zmin_spec : forall x y : Z, x <= y /\ Z.min x y = x \/ x > y /\ Z.min x y = y
Z.compare_eq : forall x y : Z, (x ?= y) = Eq -> x = y
Z_le_lt_eq_dec : forall x y : Z, x <= y -> {x < y} + {x = y}
Z_le_gt_bool : forall x y : Z, {b : bool | if b then x <= y else x > y}
Z_gt_le_bool : forall x y : Z, {b : bool | if b then x > y else x <= y}
Z_gt_dec : forall x y : Z, {x > y} + {~ x > y}
two_p_gt_ZERO : forall x : Z, 0 <= x -> two_p x > 0
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
Z_gt_le_dec : forall x y : Z, {x > y} + {x <= y}
Z_le_gt_dec : forall x y : Z, {x <= y} + {x > y}
Z_le_dec : forall x y : Z, {x <= y} + {~ x <= y}
Z_lt_dec : forall x y : Z, {x < y} + {~ x < y}
ZMicromega.narrow_interval_lower_bound : forall a b x : Z, a > 0 -> a * x >= b -> x >= ZMicromega.ceiling b a
two_p = fun x : Z => match x with | 0 => 1 | Z.pos y => two_power_pos y | Z.neg _ => 0 end : Z -> Z Arguments two_p _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : Z => match y with | 0 => 1 | Z.pos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | Z.neg _ => 0 end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.gtb = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Gt => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.gtb (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.leb = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Gt => false | _ => true end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.leb (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.ltb = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Lt => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.ltb (_ _)%Z_scope
Z_lt_ge_dec : forall x y : Z, {x < y} + {x >= y}

```coq
intros x y Hx Hy.
apply Zlt_le_weak.
apply Zmult_gt_0_compat; auto.
Qed.
```
